latex:
If in applying the quadratic formula to a quadratic equation\\
\[ f(x)\equiv ax^2 + bx + c = 0,
\]\\
it happens that $ c = \frac {b^2}{4a}$, then the graph of $ y = f(x)$ will certainly:\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ \text{have a maximum} \qquad\textbf{(B)}\ \text{have a minimum} \qquad\textbf{(C)}\ \text{be tangent to the x - axis} \\
\qquad\textbf{(D)}\ \text{be tangent to the y - axis} \qquad\textbf{(E)}\ \text{lie in one quadrant only}$
